titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Andrew Eakle, Indictment
CWG5136

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Monroe Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against
Andrew Eakle

The grand Jury of Monroe County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Andrew Eakle of the Crime of Passing Counterfeit Bank Bills Knowing them to be Counterfeit Commiteded as follows to wit the Said Andrew Eakle on the 1 day of January 1864 in the County aforesaid did Feloniously and Fraudulently pass to Mary King Two Counterfit Bank Bills of the Same Kind Twenty dollars Each on the Bank of Ashland which Said Bank was then and there by the laws of Kentucky incorporatid he the Said Eakle then and there Knowing Said Bills to be Counterfit against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

J H C Sandger
ofor Comewelth

Attest H B Marrs Clk
Monroe Circuit Court
